Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water to extract or dissipate heat, by passing water through an open loop system, for one or more private dwellings, other than multi-family building, located on a single parcel.
Reference/Note: Water use likely higher in winter months than summer months. In BC, water use for heating is more common than water use for cooling.

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water for the commercial production of ice or for making snow or ice for a recreation facility or area.
Reference/Note: There are more snow-making licenses in this category and they are larger, so uses estimated coefficients for snowmaking. Caution should be taken if upstream licenses are used for icemaking, as diversions for icemaking occur in August, which typically coincides with low flows.

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water for the operation of a sawmill, shipyard, factory or other manufacturing facility or for the operation of a wharf, and includes the use of water in a gravel washing plant or the use in an industrial context of water to prevent a fire.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Processing' (Ecofish, 2015). Water use is relatively consistent throughout year where water is used for commericial activity, but water use typically increases in summer with visitation (5-15% approximately) (Mike Carter, Port Alberni Port Authority). Landscaping irrigation is likely typically very limited at wharves.

Coefficients for 'Domestic' (Ecofish, 2015). Water use likely to double in summer due to irrigation use (irrigation typically occurs May-September, with highest use in June-Aug). Summer use is on average twice winter use. Could potentially use coefficients of 0.5 in the winter.

Description of Water License Purpose: Ice and snow making – The diversion and use of water for the commercial production of ice or for making snow or ice for a recreation facility or area.
Reference/Note: Most significant use is before Christmas (Arthur DeJong, Whistler Blackcomb). Diversion begins at some point in November, based on weather and is highest in December, in preparation for holiday visitation. Use continues (based on season), through Jan, Feb, with some use in Mar based on weather conditions.

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water for the operation of a sawmill, shipyard, factory or other manufacturing facility or for the operation of a wharf, and includes the use of water in a gravel washing plant or the use in an industrial context of water to prevent a fire.
Reference/Note: No current licenses. Used coefficients for 'Processing' (Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose: Water is used for drilling activities related to oil and natural gas development or production.
Reference/Note: Varies with market conditions and specific license conditions (e.g. EFN requirements). Use is fully consumptive (Suzan Lapp, BC Oil and Gas Commission).

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water for the operation of a church, community hall, school, hospital or other public institution.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Camps' (Ecofish, 2015). Monthly use will vary by user. Some users may use more water in the summer (e.g., due to irrigation), whereas others may use more in the winter (e.g. schools with winter attendance). For schools, May, June, and to a lesser extent, September, are likely to have higher use due to high indoor use and irrigation combined (e.g. 25% higher) (source: water license holder for this purpose).

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water for a standby system for fire protection.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Fire Protection' (Ecofish, 2015). Most of the water is used for structure fires and motor vehicle accidents (MVAs) and those can happen anytime of year. Assume water use is consistent throughout the year, as structure fires and MVAs may be more likely to occur in the winter, and wildfire is more likely to occur in the summer (Cody, Cariboo Regional District).
Coefficients for 'Fire Protection [MY]' (Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water to wash trucks, other vehicles or equipment, operate equipment to explore for, take samples or quarry rock, or to cool the brakes on logging trucks or other vehicles.
Reference/Note: Water more likely to be used more in spring through fall than winter, but may vary (Jeremy Roscoe).

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water to wash trucks, other vehicles or equipment, operate equipment to explore for, take samples or quarry rock, or to cool the brakes on logging trucks or other vehicles.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Truckwashing' (Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water for the operation of residential camps for workers.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Work Camps' (Ecofish, 2015). Water use likely to be higher in summer for some camps due to higher populations in summer, but this is not the case for all camps.
No current licenses

Description of Water License Purpose: The use of a streambed for overburden disposal.
Reference/Note: Typically used when a gully is filled and is likely to be more an approach to land and watercourse protection/management, than a diversion (Barry Watson). Likely relatively consistent 'use'.
Coefficients for 'Power-General' (Ecofish, 2015).
No current licenses

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water in an industrial context of water to prevent a fire.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Processing' (Ecofish, 2015). It is likely that the majority of the use (e.g. 80%) would be through summer and fall (e.g, spraying vegetation to reduce fire risk), but it is likely to vary by application (Barry Watson).

Purpose: O & G: Oil Fld Inject. (non-deep GW)
Description of Water License Purpose: Water that is not deep groundwater is pumped into the subsurface to assist in the recovery of oil or natural gas. [Note, ‘other than deep groundwater’ includes groundwater that is not ‘deep groundwater’ as well as stream water.]
The diversion and use of water for cooling purposes in any manufacturing, processing or industrial operation.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Processing' and 'Industrial' (Ecofish, 2015). Water use likely consistent due to challenges of shutting down and starting up processing operations.

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water for watering a golf course, sports field, park or similar property, as well as watering a commercial lawn, an ornamental garden that is not adjoining and occupied with a dwelling and the portion of an ornamental garden that is adjoining and occupied with a dwelling which garden is larger than 1 000m2.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for Irrigation. Some relatively small volumes may be used in April and October in some locations for some licenses.

Coefficients for 'Domestic' (Ecofish, 2015). Note: water use likely to double in summer due to irrigation use (irrigation typically occurs May-September, with highest use in June-Aug)r. Because use is up to half of max demand in the winter, coefficients could potentially be 0.5 in the winter in some cases.

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water for diluting or treating effluent and sewage, for the operation of a landfill or industrial composting facility or for the washing and cleaning of water intake screens. [Note, see ‘Crop harvesting and processing’ above, for water use related to agriculture vegetative waste composting operations.]
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Industrial' (Ecofish, 2015). Water use likely to be consistent througout the year with some increase in summer due to additional maintenance activities and potentially dilution requirements.

Description of Water License Purpose: The clearing or excavation of the stream channel, including for river improvement;
Reference/Note: Generally, the intent is to take water from a stream and place in another location. All existing licenses have units of TF (non-consumptive). In some cases, water may be returned to the same stream and it may be non-consumptive (Barry Watson).

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water to provide drinking water and sanitation requirements in the operation or maintenance of a kennel.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Stockwatering' (Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water to clean or wash crops, to prevent crops from reaching maturity or to delay maturation of crops, to protect crops or seedlings from frost, to harvest crops, such as cranberries or wild rice, by flooding or in agricultural vegetative waste composting operations. [Note, see ‘Waste management’ below for water use in an industrial composting facility.]
Reference/Note: This category contains several uses that happen at very different times and have very different returns flows. Given the variability within this category, water use is distributed equally through the months with the greatest likelihood of use (Feb-Nov). In areas that are under stress or places where there are large licenses for this purpose, further investigation is required.

Description of Water License Purpose:
The use in commercial bathing pools of water that is
(i) impregnated with mineral salts, elements or gases, or
(ii) naturally at a temperature suitable for that use;
? Commercial bathing pools – Mineralized water is used in commercial bathing pools.
Reference/Note: Use likely variable, Given that units in M3/day, assume consistent use.

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water for diluting or treating effluent and sewage, for the operation of a landfill or industrial composting facility or for the washing and cleaning of water intake screens. [Note, see ‘Crop harvesting and processing’ above, for water use related to agriculture vegetative waste composting operations.]
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Industrial' and 'Sewage Disposal' (Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose: Water is transported to customers by tanker truck, in bottles or similar containers.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Bottle Sales' (Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose: Water from a stream is stored so that it can be used for power production.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Storage-Power' (Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose: Water is used in the operation and/or maintenance of coal washing operations.
Reference/Note: Significant volumes of water used without any particularly seasonality to use. Water goes into a tailing pond with a long retention time. Assume fully consumptive (Jeremy Roscoe).

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water in the production of pulp and paper products or in the operation and maintenance of a pulp mill.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Pulp Mills' (Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water to wash trucks, other vehicles or equipment, operate equipment to explore for, take samples or quarry rock, or to cool the brakes on logging trucks or other vehicles.
Reference/Note: Use uncommon and likely greater in summer and fully consumptive, as water evaporates (Jeremy Roscoe, Barry Watson).
No current licenses. Used coefficients for 'Industrial' and 'Processing' (Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water for floating logs, fur farming3, fish farming or keeping fish for recreational purposes, but does not include a fish hatchery.
Reference/Note: Water use for this type of use typically does not vary from month to month (Gary Robinson, Kuterra [license holder for purpose])

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water to provide drinking water and sanitation requirements in the operation or maintenance of a kennel, an animal shelter or boarding facility, a ranch or feedlot operation, or a game farm2, dairy farm, pig farm or poultry farm, or similar enterprise for rearing livestock.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Stockwatering' (Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose: Water is conveyed by someone other than a local provider for waterworks purpose, but does not include water delivery.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Waterworks (Other) [M3/D]' (Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose: Water is conveyed by someone other than a local provider for waterworks purpose, but does not include water delivery.
Reference/Note: Same as Waterworks: Local Provider. Water use typically doubles in peak summer months due to increased use for irrigation, washing and bathing, tourism, etc.

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water for the bottling, for commercial distribution, of fresh water, including the bottling of carbonated water and water fortified with vitamins, but not including mineralized water or fermented or other processed beverages.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Bottle Sales' (Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose:
"conservation purpose" means the diversion, retention or use of water for the purpose of conserving fish or wildlife and includes the construction of works for that purpose (Section 2, WSA)
Sub purposes
? Conservation – construct works – associated with conservation purpose - Works are constructed for conserving fish or wildlife.
? Conservation – stored water – Water is stored for conserving fish or wildlife.
? Conservation – use of water – Water is used for conserving fish or wildlife.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Conserv.-Use of Water' (Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose:
"conservation purpose" means the diversion, retention or use of water for the purpose of conserving fish or wildlife and includes the construction of works for that purpose (Section 2, WSA)
Sub purposes
? Conservation – construct works – associated with conservation purpose - Works are constructed for conserving fish or wildlife.
? Conservation – stored water – Water is stored for conserving fish or wildlife.
? Conservation – use of water – Water is used for conserving fish or wildlife.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Conserv.-Use of Water' (Ecofish, 2015).

Coefficients for 'Processing' (Ecofish, 2015). Water use consistent through out year (Jeremy Roscoe). The water use would be entirely dependent on how much they were processing, which may change seasonally but shouldn't. Processing plants are expensive so they generally run at full capacity all the time. Mostly consumptive.

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water for diluting or treating effluent and sewage, for the operation of a landfill or industrial composting facility or for the washing and cleaning of water intake screens.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Industrial' and 'Sewage Disposal' (Ecofish, 2015).
No current licenses.

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water for diluting or treating effluent and sewage, for the operation of a landfill or industrial composting facility or for the washing and cleaning of water intake screens.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Sewage Disposal' (Ecofish, 2015). Typically small volumes of water that are used fairly consistently thoughout the year (staff at City of Vernon, District of Squamish [license holders for this purpose]).

Description of Water License Purpose: Water is used in the operation and/or maintenance of placer mining operations.
Reference/Note: While there are several water licenses for the whole year, water diversion for this purpose only occurs in summer months (from April-end of October or less) (Jeremy Roscoe).  Typically water is taken out of a stream, sprayed on rock nearby, then sent to a settling pond, where sediment settles out, then water infiltrates through the gravel back into the watershed or stream indirectly. Operations typically occur May til end the end of October (Barry Watson, Jeremy Roscoe). Most license periods vary from 6/7 months to a year.
Coefficients for 'Industrial' (Ecofish, 2015).
Coefficients for 'Industrial' (Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose: Diversion and use of water for the operation of a recreational camp (camp that provides one or more of the following: (a) recreational experiences; (b) educational experiences; (c) rehabilitative or therapeutic experiences for persons with disabilities or chronic or life-threatening illnesses; (d) religious instruction; (e) leadership training. [Section 1, Water Sustainability Regulation])
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Camps' (Ecofish, 2015). Likely higher use in summer for many users.

Description of Water License Purpose: Mineralized water is used for sale in bottles or other containers, but does not include fresh water bottling.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Bottle Sales' (Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose: Water from a stream is stored so that it can be used for purposes other than power production.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for Storage-Non Power' (Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose: Water is used in mining operations in which the force of the water is used to expose the minerals.
Reference/Note: While some licenses are for use for the whole year, this use typically occurs May-end of October. New licenses for this purpose are not allowed in BC anymore and there are only 3 active licenses. Water use involves using water pressure to remove material from high banks to get it lower down to get it into a sluicebox for placer mining purposes.  Water would be returned to system in a highly sediment laden form (the use involves hosing water at a hillside and water re-enters the creek) (Jeremy Roscoe).

Description of Water License Purpose: The use of water to produce fish eggs and to propagate fish by hatching fish eggs, rearing fry or sustaining brood stock under controlled conditions in a containment facility.
Reference/Note: Non-consumptive, most use is in Feb-Apr and use is similar across fish hatcheries (Jordan Uittenbogaard, Tenderfoot Hatchery).

Description of Water License Purpose: Water is conveyed by a local provider for waterworks purpose. See the definition of ‘local provider’ in the Water Sustainability Fees Rentals and Charges Tariff Regulation.
Reference/Note: Water use typically doubles in summer months due to increased use for irrigation, washing and bathing, tourism, etc. In some areas, such as the Okangan, water use can go up by 4 times in the summer. Coefficients are monthly averages, and peak day (day of highest use) is typically much higher.

Description of Water License Purpose:
Commercial enterprise – The diversion and use of water
(a) for the operation of apartment buildings, hotels, motels, restaurants, service stations, mobile home, trailer or manufactured home parks, public campgrounds, including campgrounds in public parks, and commercial campgrounds, other than campgrounds associated with recreational camps, marinas, commercial amusement parks, including water parks, or commercial enterprises, or
(b) in a food and beverage processing plant.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Enterprise [MY]' (Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose:
Commercial enterprise – The diversion and use of water
(a) for the operation of apartment buildings, hotels, motels, restaurants, service stations, mobile home, trailer or manufactured home parks, public campgrounds, including campgrounds in public parks, and commercial campgrounds, other than campgrounds associated with recreational camps, marinas, commercial amusement parks, including water parks, or commercial enterprises, or
(b) in a food and beverage processing plant.
Reference/Note: On average, use is likely higher in the summer, due to irrigation demand, tourism, higher washing and cooling requirements, etc. For some users such as food and beverage processing plants, use may not peak in the summer months.

Description of Water License Purpose: Deep groundwater is injected under high pressure to fracture a subsurface formation to assist in the recovery of oil or natural gas.
Reference/Note: Varies with market conditions and specific license conditions (e.g. EFN requirements). Use is fully consumptive (Suzan Lapp, BC Oil and Gas Commission).

Description of Water License Purpose:
Land Improvement Purpose – "land improvement purpose" means the diversion or impounding of water to (Section 2,
WSA)
(a) protect land,
(b) facilitate the development of a recreational facility or of a park or other protected area,
(c) facilitate the reclamation, drainage or other improvement of land, or
(d) carry out a project of a nature similar to a project described in paragraph (b) or (c);
Sub purposes
? Land improvement – general – Water is diverted or impounded to protect land, to facilitate the development
of a recreation facility or of a park or other protected area or the reclamation, drainage or other improvement
of land. Ponds for aesthetic purposes are included in this purpose.
? Land improvement – industrial rehabilitation or remediation purposes – Water is diverted or impounded to
protect, reclaim or drain land zoned or used for industrial purposes.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Land Improve' (Ecofish, 2015). Generally, the intent is to take water from a stream and place in another location. In some cases, water may be returned to the same stream and it may be non-consumptive. In other cases, it may be consumptive (classified as consumptive in Rood & Hamilton, 1995 and Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose:
Greenhouse and nursery – The diversion and use of water in a facility for the indoor propagation of fruits,
vegetables or other plants, or at a facility for the propagation of trees, plants or turf.
Reference/Note: Use often varies, with higher use in summer months and most use between Feb and Nov. Because units are in max M3/D, assume consistent use.

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water in a facility for the indoor propagation of fruits, vegetables or other plants.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Stockwatering' (Ecofish, 2015, verified with MAFF Livestockwatering Factsheets. Generally, summer water requirements are twice winter requirements. There is generally no return, as the majority of water goes to milk or meat.

Description of Water License Purpose:
Camp and public facility – The diversion and use of water for the operation of
(a) a church, community hall, school, hospital or other public institution,
(b) public facilities such as drinking fountains, washrooms or public water parks, or
(c) public exhibition grounds, residential camps for workers or recreational camps1,
but excluding public or commercial campgrounds, except campgrounds that are part of a recreational camp.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Camps' and 'Public Facilities (Ecofish, 2015). Water use is likely to be higher in the summer for most users.

This category contains a wide range of uses and while water use is likely to go up in the summer and may not occur for some of these purposes in the winter, given that the max units are in M3/D, and the wide range of uses, the coefficents are assumed to be consistent.

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water to protect crops or seedlings from frost.
Reference/Note: Based on conversations with Carolyn Teasdale, Stephanie Tam, Ted van der Gulik.

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water for dust control, soil compaction.
Reference/Note: While many licenses are for the full year, the majority of use is likely when there is less precipitation, between April and October.

Description of Water License Purpose: "conservation purpose" means the diversion, retention or use of water for the purpose of conserving fish or wildlife and includes the construction of works for that purpose (Section 2, WSA). Subpurpose: Water is stored for conserving fish or wildlife.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Conserv.-Constr.Works' and 'Storage-Non Power' (Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water for the washing and cleaning of water intake screens.
Reference/Note: No current licenses. 1 Abandoned license.

Description of Water License Purpose:
Power Purpose – "power purpose" means the use of water in the production of electricity or other power (Section 2, WSA)
Sub purpose - Power Commercial – Water Fees, Rentals and Charges Tariff Regulation Section 16 – “commercial” means the use, other than residential, of the capacity and energy generated from one or more power developments owned by the licensee, or of the entitlement to capacity and energy derived from water licences held by the licensee,
(a) by the licensee, or if sold by the licensee to immediate family members, employees or tenants of the licensee, by those persons, if the sum of the construction capacity and operating capacity of the licensee’s power development, or if the licensee has more than one power development, the sum of the construction capacity and operating capacity of the licensee’s power developments, does not exceed 499 kW,
(b) for the extraction or processing of natural resources, or the manufacturing of products, in a primary industrial facility in which the licensee has an interest of more than 50%, or
(c) in a facility that is adjacent to and integrated with a primary industrial facility in which the licensee has an interest of more than 50%, but only to the extent that the capacity and energy used in the adjacent and integrated facility is for the production of output consumed in or for the use of the industrial processes of the licensee;
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Power-Commercial' (Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose:
"power purpose" means the use of water in the production of electricity or other power (Section 2, WSA)
Power Residential – Water Fees, Rentals and Charges Tariff Regulation Section 16 – “residential” means the use of the capacity and energy generated from a power development if
(a) the sum of the construction capacity and operating capacity of the power development does not exceed 50 kW, and
(b) that capacity is used to supply the household requirements of the licensee, including the requirements of any outbuildings, and may also be used in part to participate in the BC Hydro Net Metering Program.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Power-Residential' (Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water for the operation of commercial amusement parks.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Enterprise' (Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose: Not defined.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Domestic' (Ecofish, 2015). Note: water use likely to double in summer due to irrigation use (irrigation typically occurs May-September, with highest use in June-Aug), and be approximately half of that in winter. Could potentially use coefficients of 0.5 in the winter.

Description of Water License Purpose: Ice and snow making – The diversion and use of water for the commercial production of ice or for making snow or ice for a recreation facility or area.
Reference/Note: Water use varies. It is likely greatest in late July, early August (about 25% of yearly water is consumed in this time when the rink is created) and then maintenance use from Sep-Mar for levelling, etc.) (Rob Pakulak, City of Nanaimo). Most arenas remove their ice in March for lacrosse season (March-June) and put their ice back in between June and August because many communities have hockey camps starting in August. (For this reason, water is most likely to be used in late July, early August).

Description of Water License Purpose: Miscellaneous industrial – The diversion of water to dewater a construction site, mine or similar excavation;
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Industrial' (Ecofish, 2015).
While some water licenses are for the whole year, water use is most likely to happen in the months between Apr-Nov, following precipitation deficits (Barry Watson).
No current licenses.

Description of Water License Purpose: Greenhouse and nursery – The diversion and use of water in a facility for the indoor propagation of fruits, vegetables or other plants, or at a facility for the propagation of trees, plants or turf.
Reference/Note: Use coeffcients for Nurseries. The largest users in this category are nureries, so the coefficients for nursery use are included, as that is a more conservative approach (nurseries use more than greenhouses in summer).

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water for the operation and maintenance of a public or private swimming pool by a person that does not hold a licence for another industrial water use to which the swimming pool is incidental.
Reference/Note: Use likely varies throughout year.
No current licenses.

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water to provide drinking water and sanitation requirements in the operation or maintenance of a kennel, an animal shelter or boarding facility, a ranch or feedlot operation, or a game farm2, dairy farm, pig farm or poultry farm, or similar enterprise for rearing livestock.
Reference/Note: Based on MAFF Livestock Watering Factsheets. Returns are 0 as the water goes to animal/milk/meat.
Coefficients for 'Stockwatering [MD]' (Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose:
Water is diverted or impounded to protect land, to facilitate the development
of a recreation facility or of a park or other protected area or the reclamation, drainage or other improvement
of land. Ponds for aesthetic purposes are included in this purpose.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Land Improve' (Ecofish, 2015). Generally, the intent is to take water from a stream and place in another location. In some cases, water may be returned to the same stream and it may be non-consumptive. In other cases, it may be consumptive. Identified as consumptive in Rood & Hamilton, 1995.

Description of Water License Purpose: "Irrigation Purpose" means the use of water on cultivated land or hay meadows to nourish crops or on pasture to nourish forage; (Section 2, WSA). Water is used for irrigation purpose, other than provided by a local provider.
Reference/Note: Coefficients obtained from BC Agriculture Water Calculator and Agriculture Water Demand Model runs for several BC watersheds (Delta, Kelowna, Koksilah). Confirmed with Ted van der Gulik and Stephanie Tam (MAFF).

Description of Water License Purpose: The impoundment of water in a settling pond for sediment control
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Industrial' (Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water to harvest crops, such as cranberries or wild rice, by flooding.
Reference/Note: Based on conversations with Carolyn Teasdale, Stephanie Tam, Ted van der Gulik.

Description of Water License Purpose: Water that is not deep groundwater is pumped into the subsurface to assist in the recovery of oil or natural gas. [Note, ‘other than deep groundwater’ includes groundwater that is not ‘deep groundwater’ as well as stream water.]
Reference/Note: Varies with market conditions and specific license conditions (e.g. EFN requirements). Use is fully consumptive (Suzan Lapp, BC Oil and Gas Commission).

Description of Water License Purpose: The use of water for public exhibition grounds.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Camps' and 'Public Facilities' (Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose: Water from an aquifer is stored so that it can be used for purposes other than power production
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Storage-Non Power' (Ecofish, 2015). This would be associated with a diversion purpose.

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water to wash trucks, other vehicles or equipment, operate equipment to explore for, take samples or quarry rock, or to cool the brakes on logging trucks or other vehicles.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Truckwashing' (Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water for watering a  the portion of a lawn or ornamental garden that is adjoining and occupied with a dwelling which garden/lawn is larger than 1 000m2.
Reference/Note: Based on variations in use for Irrigation. It is likely that most water use would occur during growing months (May-Sep) but in some areas, may occur in Apr-Oct..

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water for watering a golf course, sports field, park or similar property, as well as watering a commercial lawn, an ornamental garden that is not adjoining and occupied with a dwelling and the portion of an ornamental garden that is adjoining and occupied with a dwelling which garden is larger than 1 000m2.
Reference/Note: Based on variations in use for Irrigation. It is likely that most water use would occur during growing months (May-Sep) but in some areas, may occur in Apr-Oct..

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water for the operation of a sawmill, shipyard, factory or other manufacturing facility or for the operation of a wharf, and includes the use of water in a gravel washing plant or the use in an industrial context of water to prevent a fire.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Processing' (Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose: Water is supplied by a local provider for irrigation purpose within the local provider’s service area. See the definition of ‘local provider’ in the Water Sustainability Fees Rentals and Charges Tariff Regulation.
Reference/Note: Coefficients obtained from BC Agriculture Water Calculator and Agriculture Water Demand Model runs for several BC watersheds (Delta, Kelowna, Koksilah). Confirmed with Ted van der Gulik and Stephanie Tam (MAFF).

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water for the operation of a church or community hall
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Camps' and 'Public Facilities' (Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water to prevent crops from reaching maturity or to delay maturation of crops.
Reference/Note: Crop suppression is not based on crop water demand so it really depends on how it is applied.  Suppression would likely not happen until near the end of July, August and September so the breakdown would be approximately July 35%, August 50% and September 15% (Ted Van der Gulik, 2021).

Description of Water License Purpose:
The diversion and use of water
(a) for the operation of apartment buildings, hotels, motels, restaurants, service stations, mobile home, trailer or manufactured home parks, public campgrounds, including campgrounds in public parks, and commercial campgrounds, other than campgrounds associated with recreational camps, marinas, commercial amusement parks, including water parks, or commercial enterprises, or
(b) in a food and beverage processing plant.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Enterprise' (Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water in industrial and commercial operations to extract or dissipate heat by passing water through an open loop system.
Reference/Note: Water use likely higher in winter months than summer months. In BC, water use for heating is more common than water use for cooling.

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water for the operation of a sawmill, shipyard, factory or other manufacturing facility or for the operation of a wharf, and includes the use of water in a gravel washing plant or the use in an industrial context of water to prevent a fire.
Reference/Note: Coefficients for 'Processing' (Ecofish, 2015).

Description of Water License Purpose: Water that is not deep groundwater is injected under high pressure to fracture a subsurface formation to assist in the recovery of oil or natural gas. [Note, ‘other than deep groundwater’ includes groundwater that is not ‘deep groundwater’ and stream water.]
Reference/Note: Varies with market conditions and specific license conditions (e.g. EFN requirements). Use is fully consumptive (Suzan Lapp, BC Oil and Gas Commission).

Description of Water License Purpose: Water is sold to customers by the authorization holder, other than water delivery.
Reference/Note: Same as Waterworks: Local Provider. Water use typically doubles in peak summer months due to increased use for irrigation, washing and bathing, tourism, etc.

Description of Water License Purpose: same as waterworks local provider
Reference/Note: Same as Waterworks: Local Provider. Water use typically doubles in peak summer months due to increased use for irrigation, washing and bathing, tourism, etc.

Description of Water License Purpose: The diversion and use of water in a facility for the indoor propagation of trees, plants or turf.
Reference/Note: Based on actual use data from a 25-acre nursery in the Fraser Valley, provided by Dave Woodske, P.Ag. | Industry Specialist, Ornamentals and Greenhouse Vegetables, Ministry of Agriculture
